How to Spot a #MachineLearning Opportunity, Even If You Aren’t a Data Scientist

The average company faces many challenges getting started with machine learning, including a shortage of #DataScientists. But just as important is the shortage of executives and nontechnical employees able to spot #AI opportunities.

And spotting those opportunities doesn’t require a PhD in #statistics or even the ability to write #code. Having an intuition for how machine learning #algorithms work – even in the most general sense – is becoming an important business skill.
Machine learning scientists can’t, and shouldn't work in a vacuum from the operations of a business. Stakeholders should help them;
• allocate SME's to distill knowledge into labels for data sets,
• set the objectives for algorithmic success.
This Harvard Business Review piece by Kathryn Hume is a good read.

As the CTO, I am responsible and manage all internal systems and all technology projects within the organization.  Also responsible for all offshore development projects that are ongoing at our Bangalore, India offshore office.

Chief Architect and founder of www.EliteTee.com.  Instrumental in building the technology solution that fully automates the relationship between golf clubs and golfers, allowing private club members to expand their golf experience and membership.  Built a smart system that minimizes the human factor required to manage day to day operations of the business.  Check us out at http://www.elitetee.com

Chief Architect and visionary around the cDevWorkflow - next generation business process(bpm/workflow) product for any industry/technology vertical.  After building many bpm solutions for Fortune 100 organizations, finally had to put the pedal to the metal and build a bpm solution that can out perform and outlast any other bpm solution on the market.

As the Head coordinator for Weymouth soccer, I am responsible for implementing all technology solutions to manage the town soccer program.  As the head coordinator, also responsible for building and managing over 120 soccer teams, consiting of ~1400 players, 120+ coaches, and over 60 games each Saturday.
Sits on the board of advisory to help the school make better, smarter decisions on many aspects of the school.  Also co-chair of the technology comittee.

Sean Williams
Owner at Lucca Restaurants, Founder at Elite Tee
January 17, 2016, Dileepa worked with Sean in the same group

I first met Dileepa to discuss an idea I had about linking private country clubs by creating software to automate their reciprocal rounds.  On the first meeting I was really impressed with his ability to take a concept he was unfamiliar with, and provide ideas to improve the company.  I soon realized that he would be an extremely valuable asset, so I quickly asked him to join me as co-founder and Elite Tee was born.  By utilizing the software he created we were able to build a company that is being used by over a thousand private country clubs across the country.  He is extremely organized and completes projects quickly and efficiently.  His ability to take ideas and implement them above and beyond expectations is something that I am sure will serve him well in any projects he works on.
